Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Inkwell
Description: This trapezoid-shaped object with diagonal panels has a very large flat surface that was hammered at in the centre.  This hammering created a cupule in which the colouring, the basic product in production of ink, was placed.
